translation.title: The Simile of Hands and Feet (1st)

next.name: The Simile of Hands and Feet (2nd)

segments.en: 236. The Simile of Hands and Feet (1st)
“Mendicants, when there are hands, picking up and putting down are found.
When there are feet, coming and going are found.
When there are joints, contracting and extending are found.
When there’s a belly, hunger and thirst are found.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusmiṃ sati cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, when there’s an eye, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by eye contact.

segments.pli: jivhāya sati jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe …
segments.en: When there’s an ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: manasmiṃ sati manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe ….
segments.en: mind, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by mind contact.

segments.pli: Hatthesu, bhikkhave, asati ādānanikkhepanaṃ na paññāyati;
segments.en: When there are no hands, picking up and putting down aren’t found.
When there are no feet, coming and going aren’t found.
When there are no joints, contracting and extending aren’t found.

segments.pli: kucchismiṃ asati jighacchā pipāsā na paññāyati.
segments.en: When there’s no belly, hunger and thirst aren’t found.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusmiṃ asati cakkhusamphassapaccayā nuppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ … pe …
segments.en: In the same way, when there’s no eye, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
When there’s no ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: manasmiṃ asati manosamphassapaccayā nuppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhan”ti.
segments.en: mind, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by mind contact.”
